preface.title: Preface

note.para: This documentation is in transition from the NeXus wiki site to DocBook. Simultaneously, NeXus is introducing the NeXus Definition Language (NXDL) to define base classes and application definitions. Parts of the manual may still need revision to conform to the NXDL.

preface.para:
NeXus is a data storage format designed and intended for storage of data from experiments and analyses in the fields of neutron, muon, and X-ray science. The files are portable, self describing, extendable, and the software to read and write the files (the NeXus API, or NAPI) API is in the public domain. There are four levels to the NeXus Standard:
Physical File format and API for accessing Files
Rules for storing data in Files
Base class and application definitions
NeXus Utilities
Each of these levels is described in this manual.
